required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine Preferences Towards Interface Products
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Determine Clinician and Patient Preferences Towards Interface Products Recommended by the 3D Mask Advice Tool

brief_summary.textblock: Enrolled Na√Øve participants will be randomized to one of two arms, the investigational or control arm. Once randomized the institutions will fit the participant with the procedures outlined in the protocol. Each participant will be required to trial the mask for a period of 90 days. Any Unscheduled Visits or Calls that occur during the participants 90 days documented.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants requiring one or more mask re-fits
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants in each arm requiring one or more mask re-fits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of masks tried during the initial fitting visit
secondary_outcome.description: Number of masks tried during the initial fitting visit in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of masks tried after going home with the first mask
secondary_outcome.description: Number of masks tried after going home with the first mask in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of time to fit each mask
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of time to fit each mask in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of sleep clinic or sleep center callbacks related to mask fitting issues
secondary_outcome.description: Number of sleep clinic or sleep center callbacks related to mask fitting issues in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: The amount of time spent on these calls to resolve mask issues
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of time spent on these calls to resolve mask issues in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of unplanned visits to adjust current mask or fit with another masks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of unplanned visits to adjust current mask or fit with another masks in each arm.
Duration of the unplanned visits in each arm.
Adherence to CPAP therapy as determined by average hours of use
Mask leak for chosen masks in each arm.

Patients will complete a "Post-Trial Questionnaire" to rate their post-trial experience, on a 0-10 scale. "0" meaning strongly disagree/unlikely, "10" meaning strongly agree/likely. A higher score means a better outcome.

Clinicians will complete a "Post-Trial Questionnaire" to rate their post-trial experience, on a 0-10 scale. "0" meaning strongly disagree/unlikely, "10" meaning strongly agree/likely. A higher score means a better outcome.

intervention.description: Participants will have a Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) mask chosen to wear for a period of 90 days as provided by the sites standard of care.
Participants will have a Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) mask chosen to wear for a period of 90 days as provided by the mask advice tool.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult Volunteers (ages 21-85)
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Able to follow instructions
- Able to read and speak in English as their primary language
- Currently diagnosed with Sleep Apnea through an in-lab sleep (polysomnography (PSG)) or home sleep testing, but has not started therapy and/or been fit with a mask.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing conditions such as bullous lung disease, pathologically low blood pressure, bypassed upper airway, pneumothorax, pneumocephalus, cerebral spinal fluid (CSF) leaks, cribriform plate abnormalities, and prior history of head trauma that has resulted in current cognitive dysfunction.
- Prescribed an Adaptive Servo Ventilation (ASV) device
- The presence of physical or mental limitations that would limit the ability to test the mask.
- Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) diagnosis achieved through a split night sleep study
- Known allergy to silicone
- Unique facial features (i.e. deformities of the face and/or head, piercings, etc) that could interfere with the use of masks.
- Employee of Philips or spouse of a Philips employee
- Currently participating in another interventional research study or planned participation in another interventional research study during the trial period (by self-report)
- Surgery involving the eyes, ears, nose, sinuses, or upper airway within the last 90 days.
- Planned surgical procedures involving the head, neck, face (eyes, ears, nose), or lung during the trial period.
- Uncontrolled or poorly managed gastroesophageal reflux
- Impaired cough reflex
- Untreated or symptomatic hiatal hernia
- Untreated glaucoma
- Untreated chronic dry eyes
- Unable to remove the sleep apnea mask without the assistance of others
- Use of prescription drugs that induce vomiting

facility.name: Pulmonary Disease Specialists, PA, d/b/a PDS Research
Center for Sleep and Wake Disorders
